decks.notes: This Legacy 1 vs 1 deck is a control deck that focuses on utilizing the BUG (Black, Blue, Green) color combination. The deck aims to control the game by using cards like Witherbloom Command, Stifle, Sheoldred's Edict, and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to disrupt the opponent's strategy and remove their threats. It also includes various countermagic spells such as Force of Will and Daze to protect itself. The deck also utilizes card draw and manipulation with Ponder, Brainstorm, and Mystic Sanctuary to ensure consistent resource management. Overall, it is a control deck that thrives on disruption and resource advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly swarm the field with a horde of goblin creatures and overwhelm the opponent through aggressive tactics. The deck relies on cards like Goblin Ringleader, Goblin Matron, and Muxus, Goblin Grandee to rapidly generate more goblins and generate card advantage. It also includes cards like Goblin Rabblemaster and Battle Cry Goblin to boost the power and effectiveness of the goblin creatures. The deck aims to control the game with cards like Chalice of the Void and disrupt the opponent's strategies.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent's life total while disrupting their game plan. By utilizing a combination of powerful creatures like Murktide Regent, Stalactite Stalker, Troll of Khazad-d√ªm, and Orcish Bowmasters, along with efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Snuff Out, the deck aims to control the board and maintain tempo advantage. The inclusion of disruptive elements such as Grief and Counterspells like Force of Will and Daze further adds to the deck's ability to disrupt opponent plays. The deck's mana base, including fetch lands and dual lands, allows for consistent access to the necessary colors and card advantage through cards like Brainstorm and Ponder.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of artifacts and blue cards to create an aggressive playstyle. The deck makes use of cards like Urza's Saga and Urza's Bauble to generate value and card advantage. It also includes disruption with cards like Pithing Needle and Chalice of the Void to slow down opponents. The deck focuses on using artifacts to its advantage, relying on cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Lotus Petal to generate mana and maintain a fast and efficient tempo.

This Legacy Lands Control deck focuses on using lands as both a resource and a win condition. By utilizing cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token, the deck can quickly close out games. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Sphere of Resistance and Wasteland to control the opponent's board state and mana production. Life from the Loam helps to consistently recur key lands from the graveyard, while Crop Rotation and Expedition Map allow for easy access to crucial pieces of the deck.

The key concept of this deck revolves around utilizing a combination of cards and abilities to disrupt the opponent and quickly assemble a win condition. The deck focuses on using cards like Thoughtseize, Grief, and Opposition Agent to control the opponent's hand and limit their resources. Leyline of the Void and Dauthi Voidwalker are used to shut down graveyard strategies. Combo pieces like Helm of Obedience and Leyline of the Void, combined with Reanimate and Dark Ritual, allow for powerful and unexpected game-ending plays. The inclusion of Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Orcish Bowmasters provide additional control and removal options.

This deck focuses on the combo between Painter's Servant and Grindstone to mill the opponent's entire library. It utilizes cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Thought Monitor to generate card advantage and help find the combo pieces. Force of Will provides protection against opposing disruption, while Mox Opal and Ancient Tomb allow for fast mana acceleration. Urza's Saga is used to search for artifacts, including Grindstone. The deck also includes control elements like Metallic Rebuke and Pithing Needle to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo and win by milling the opponent's library.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Stoneforge Mystic. It also utilizes powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares to control the board. The deck's synergy relies on efficient creatures and disruptive elements to slow down the opponent's game plan, while also having the option to blink creatures with cards like Solitude and Flickerwisp for additional value. The use of Aether Vial and Recruiter of the Guard helps maintain a consistent board presence and adapt to different situations.

The main focus of this deck is to play aggressively with Death's Shadow as a key creature, utilizing cards like Street Wraith and Stalactite Stalker to support its strategy. The deck also includes various ways to control the opponent's board with cards like Force of Will, Daze, and Orcish Bowmasters. Reanimate and Grief provide potential graveyard shenanigans to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The land base is tailored for efficient mana fixing and disruption with Wasteland and fetch lands. This deck aims to apply pressure quickly and decisively to secure victory.

The deck revolves around the use of the Doomsday card to set up a game-ending combo. The player uses efficient mana sources such as Lion's Eye Diamond, Dark Ritual, and Lotus Petal to quickly generate mana and cast spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will for disruption. The deck focuses on deck manipulation with cards like Ponder, Brainstorm, and Personal Tutor to find and set up the perfect Doomsday pile, which usually includes Thassa's Oracle for the win condition. The deck also includes counter spells like Force of Will and Daze for protection.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Control - Stiflenought deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control of the board through counterspells and card manipulation. It emphasizes tempo and resource denial using cards like Wasteland and Stifle to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The deck also includes creatures like Phyrexian Dreadnought and Murktide Regent as win conditions, while utilizing spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect its own game plan. Overall, this deck aims to control the game, create openings, and limit the opponent's options.

The key concept of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to aggressively disrupt the opponent's hand and board while quickly dealing damage. The deck achieves this by using cards such as Thoughtseize and Grief to strip the opponent's hand, while utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt and Molten Collapse to deal direct damage. The deck also includes powerful reanimation spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate to bring back threatening creatures like Stalactite Stalker and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. Overall, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and capitalize on the opponent's vulnerabilities to secure a quick victory.
